item.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant at SEAL Lab
item.description:
My Journey with Meteor Detection at SEAL Lab

Have you ever stopped to think about how much space debris is falling to Earth every single day? Well, NASA estimates that 48.5 tons of meteoritic material hits our planet daily! When I first read that, I was mind-blown. This sparked my interest in studying meteor showers more closelyâ€”and what better way to do that than by diving into the world of signal processing, antennas, and space science?
